ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: none
1 hour
Just 1 hour. This isn't a real class. It's more of a department seminar series.
N/A
0 hours
negligible.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: it's wonderful
Unfortunately, I wasn't able to attend many of the speakers due to class and meeting conflicts. Would it be possible to change the time to 6pm?
very informative
the speakers were good but the food was not
This was a great opportunity to hear from speakers in careers related to health policy.
It was good. I really liked some of the speakers. For example the woman from the Obama admin that spoke on open data and the woman from Mannatt.
I liked the selection of speakers! I think the selection this year is a lot better than the selection we had in Spring 2015.

I like this course but I felt like some of the lectures were above my level of understanding but the talks improved greatly as the semester progressed. I would have appreciated some reading material sent before the lectures. The instructor should consider providing us with a list of basic legal terms at the beginning of the course, just like she does in her Public Health Law course. This would really help international students.
Interesting lecturers! Shelley did a great job of finding engaging and interesting speakers. I do wish there were more globally focused speakers.
The class was great with many diverse speakers.

Some talks were interesting, like the gun control and unite for sight. The overall feeling of the course seemed like an opportunity for the presenter to talk about personal experiences, and for us to listen and ask questions later, time permitting. It felt more like a career-services info session than a lecture, which I do not know if is good or bad.. Free food is a major plus.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Shelley did a great job with finding speakers for our seminar. I thoroughly enjoyed them. Shelley was very professional and the seminars started and ended in a timely manner.
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Shelley is awesome!
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Shelly was awesome! I really liked the selection of speakers that she brought in this semester.
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  very good
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  you can tell she cares about this course and wants to improve it so it can be the bets it can be
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Shelley is great. It was really nice of her to organize this seminar for all of us.
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Professor Geballe is too great!

Instructor: Shelley Geballe  I wish the instructor had shared with us more about her work. She is a cool lady that has made a lot significant contributions so it would have been fun to see that side of her. She does a terrific job at asking for our input and taking it into account for future speakers.
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  wonderful!
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Great class that was very organized. Hope there is a similar class next semester.
Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Very helpful and concerned with making sure we succeed. This class is a sign of that dedication.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Overall, the seminar is great for learning about applications and gives real world context of health policy.
It's great!

Great selection of speakers! On the whole, I really liked this seminar. One small note for future students -- the timing of the class was kind of frustrating. It met at different times on different weeks (i.e. some weeks noon, some weeks 5pm), so plan for that when you're putting together your schedule.
very good
it is useful and you should go to see all the speakers.
I did not go to a lot of these, because they were 12-1 on my clinic day. I wish these were more sensitive to scheduling for people that have jobs and obligations. For example in evenings

I would recommend checking the speaker list and coming to the lectures that are of special interest. I think this course has room for improvement but I appreciate having a course tailored to health policy students.
Yes, it is a good opportunity to hear the many roads a public health degree can take one.
It is mandatory, so go, for free food and to see where others have succeeded before you, and learn what you will from their stories.
